website_summaries.verdict: While not for everyone, the WD TV's adroit playback of video and music files makes it the perfect living room box for people with large digital media collections.
pros: The WD TV plays back pretty much any file format you can throw at it, including MKV, AVI, and MP4 video
Huge HD video files played smoothly without any hiccups
Its native app selection includes 80 choices, such as YouTube, Hulu Plus, Spotify, and Pandora
cons: Its streaming video support is subpar, lacking Netflix, Amazon Instant Video HBO Go and others
Many apps, especially YouTube, suffered from sluggish load times

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I've got access to 2 of these now
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I've got access to 2 of these now. These are ideal for people looking to play media from local sources (network, server, external drives). If all you are looking for is internet streaming movies, then there are less expensive (and more current) options. This device has no troubles handling everything I've thrown at it - from ripped BDs to a large selection of various quality HD mp4s and mkvs. It's small and basic looking. Cons: I don't think WD is supporting it anymore and the custom/modding scene doesn't seem particularly active or interesting. Just adding additional movie info scrapers appears to be a fairly advanced task. The lack of production is also driving up price.
customer_reviews.author: J. YZ

customer_reviews.title: just could be a lot better. The company might have stopped supporting this device ...
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat sluggish interface. Often after I unplug my hard drive, put some content on it, reattach and plug back into power, it can't detect the hard drive the first time it boots. Seems to work the second time I powercycle the box. It's bearable, just could be a lot better. The company might have stopped supporting this device since it hasn't released any firmware upgraded in a long time. Youtube app crashes. It seems to support most popular video formats, e.g. mp4, mkv, etc.
customer_reviews.author: DashNY

customer_reviews.title: this devices will give you pretty much pain free access
customer_reviews.text: Not typically a fan of WD, but sometimes they get it right and this Media player is one of those. If you have ripped your DVD/Blueray collection to someplace on your LAN, this devices will give you pretty much pain free access. The quality is very good. The WiFi hardware is better than I expected and easy to configure. Playback quality is excellent. Internet streaming is excellent. Over all, a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: WD TV Media Player
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and very versitile player. Plays a larger number of formats, unlike the Roku player. Also, unlike the Roku; it will play your media files off an external USB device withouth having to pay an additonal charge (AND you do not have to create an account on a web site to enable and use features). The only negative is the lack of builtin NetFlix, but as my Blu-Ray player and TV both have that; it is not a show stopper.
customer_reviews.author: James Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: On the good side, this player lived up to expectations on ...
customer_reviews.text: On the good side, this player lived up to expectations on the format front. Skipping format conversion is a fine thing. When used with a USB thumb drive, the player worked as expected. The interface, on the other hand, is on the 'meh' side of the spectrum. The interaction design is pretty crummy with both the supplied remote and the downloadable remote. With a PS3, Apple TV, Roku and a Smart TV, I know how easy media browsing should really be. Maybe they let the engineers design the experience... I'm sure it makes sense to someone.
customer_reviews.author: LQ9

customer_reviews.title: Super Product
customer_reviews.text: I've loved this from day one. I plug in a USB 3.0 hard drive with my movies that I've converted to .iso format and they play perfect on my 73" HD TV. I also sometimes put a movie on a USB 3.0 thumb drive and plug it into the front slot and it will play just as good. It also has the other internet apps that are also so good but I bought it to mainly play my movies on. I don't have to go through all my DVD's and Blu-ray's to find a movie to watch. Makes it much easier for a person in a wheel chair.
customer_reviews.author: E Miller

customer_reviews.title: Note that I have a good wireless AC router
customer_reviews.text: I have other WD media player but I connect them hard wire and not wireless or via USB stick or hard drive. This unit connects with no problem to my wireless router which is connected in my basement. Note that I have a good wireless AC router. But still with the distance, it connects pretty well. It has apps like pandora, that may be used for this device. It freezes sometime and needed a reboot. It can be slow navigating to the different apps and that is the reason I only gave it a 4 star. Overall, I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Batotski

customer_reviews.title: This Playe Has Problems
customer_reviews.text: First, it's performance is atrocious. Played the help video after hooking it up and it took almost five minutes to load. Tried to update the firmware and it kept telling me there was a network error even when streaming worked just fine. At one point, it used enough bandwidth to cause a momentary interruption in my pc's connection. Couple all that with the fact that they removed Netflix, and it's a subpar player. The only redeeming quality I found was the customer service which while eager to please, ultimately ended up being useless. Save your money and buy something else. This is a step backward for Western Digital.
customer_reviews.author: wondrhampster

customer_reviews.title: Plays everything without a hitch
customer_reviews.text: After almost a year, I can safely say my WDTV works great for a media player. It has handled every format tossed at and never stuttered. I have a raid drive plugged in via USB that it reads effortlessly. For output I send sound to my AV player vis optical cable (tousling) and HDMI to my TV. Very friendly user interface and simple to set up. For the money it serves my needs better than an Apple TV or Roku
customer_reviews.author: Ron T

customer_reviews.title: Good price and easy to use, 5 units have not failed
customer_reviews.text: I have two of them myself and my broth-in-law has one and my friend has two also. We love them! Works with WiFi and Ethernet cable. Use the wired Ethernet for the 1080 P files, they work faster on passing the large files, WiFI is just for the little stuff, or plug a HDD into the unit. I use a Synology NAS for all the video files, 6 tera worth. Love the set up! My oldest unit is 9 years old, it might only get reset once in a while if it gets stuck. Just unplug the power and plug it back in to reset. I just don't know if WD is still writing firmware up grades for it anymore?
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lucas

customer_reviews.title: It would be better if Western Digital would put a bit more developing ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this all the time. It would be better if Western Digital would put a bit more developing into this. The firmware should be updated more as some of the apps are buggy. One in particular is Hulu. Oh, and I would have given it a lower ranking for not having Netflix when the prior model did. How ridiculous! But, I could not give it lower than a three star rating, because I love how it plays practically any media file. We use it mainly for that.
customer_reviews.author: bald_eagle

customer_reviews.title: Horrible User Interface But Plays Variety of File Types with Good Picture Quality
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of the WD Media player that died after 7 years. I upgraded to this as a replacement. The interface in this one is more complex, which in some ways is good but in others bad. I do wish it was more user friendly and intuitive. Compared to the older version, this plays a larger library of file types and file sizes. It also renders the video quality much better and will play subtitle files (the original one had to have the subtitle embedded into the file). It has a push2TV function, but I have not used it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A. Steele

customer_reviews.title: My all-time favorite media player
customer_reviews.text: My all-time favorite media player, and I have tried a bevy of others with little satisfaction. I use media servers on my network that store and play back a variety of video formats. These boxes don't require you to join any clubs or services, though they are available if you want to. They just play your stuff so you can sit back and enjoy it! I have 4 of them!
customer_reviews.author: Kona Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Even better when combined with WD MyCloud
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product if you are using it the way it is suppose to be used. The WD Media Player isn't meant for Netflix, it is meant to read any file from your collection. I pair the WD TV Media Player with the WD MyCloud to have my entire collection in my personal cloud storage streamed seamlessly to the WD TV Media Player. As long as you have good bandwith, you will be able to watch anything on your hard drive of cloud storage drive without a hitch. Solid product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: wjliang22

customer_reviews.title: great with if your ok with some workarounds
customer_reviews.text: It does play most of my home videos without a hitch. And overall a welcome addition to my htpc arsenal. There are the following issues Ive stumbled on : * does not work with some mkv files (e.g. dual audio with h264 at 720p) * some video taken with my cell phone at 1080p plays choppy (work around by reconverting them with handbrake). YMMV *the android app does not work if you want to turn it on or has even crashed my device on multiple occasions. So I keep the included remote handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for movies
customer_reviews.text: I use it primarily with a USB 1 TB hard drive to watch movies that I download to the hard drive. It outputs via HDMI to my receiver. It will play every format from VOB's to Blue Rays. It becomes a network drive and I can download directly to it from my desktop PC. The hard drive can double as a backup drive. But occasionally I need to reboot it. Not a big deal. There is nothing else that I can find that will do what the WD TV can do.
customer_reviews.author: LakeT

customer_reviews.title: Remote control died (only "right" button still works)
customer_reviews.text: Remote control died (only "right" button still works) - intermittently, one or more other buttons (left, down, select) will work.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good unit but need to more improvements.
customer_reviews.text: It displays wonderful pictures. However, its future is really problem. The user cannot easy to navigate. For example, when I turn on the unit, I want to go directly to the film that I watched yesterday night. But, I have to move around before I can get what I want. Moreover, If I make a mistake in choosing the film, I have to press so many arrows before I get the film I like. Note: if you press so fast or too much, the unit will be screwed of.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great For Traveling
customer_reviews.text: I use this product with a portable hard drive in place of my DVDs...All I need is this product with my portable hard drive and I have a few hundred DVD quality movies to watch. Very nice while traveling...Only negative is that it takes a while to boot up and compile your library. FYI, I was having problems using a 4TB hard drive with this product. Western Digital has told me that the largest hard drive this product can handle is 2TB.
customer_reviews.author: Nobu

customer_reviews.title: I love the functionality
customer_reviews.text: I love the functionality. However, I don't like at all how slow this is reading content from an external drive simply to display a menu. And it seems to do this on *EVERY* start up! Add to that the fact that it shuts itself down (to save power?) when not in use, and we spend more time watching it build its menus than actually playing our content.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin White

customer_reviews.title: Great at playing movies
customer_reviews.text: Great at playing movies. But it died in 2017 (bought it in 2015) as it doesn't always recognize USB drives or connect online, and now it won't even process sound correctly. Horrible build quality. I cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TECH STATEMENTS INACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: Really hacked off. Info says it will work with passport ultra. I have a 2 TB passport ultra. The file choices are NTFS and exFAT. Unfortunately this player requires FAT 32 so the passport will not register. Marketing types at work again. Tell them anything to get the product out the door, and who cares if the info is inaccurate? t
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect streaming box for personal content
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect TV companion if you prefer to stream your own digital content to a TV from a computer/server. I would not recommend this product for those who want a set top box for online streaming sources (i.e. Netflix, etc.). This box can do some of that, but that's not it's M.O. I've thrown many video containers/file types at it and it plays them all with little fuss.
customer_reviews.author: rsharp

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to play movies from my hard drive (without a computer) but Apple TV and Roku players are mainly for streaming. This media player is truly plug and play with HDMI to tv, USB to my WD MyBook hard drive, and wifi to my network. No problem playing avi, mkv, and mp4 files. Not much into streaming (my tv has Netflix) but it does offer some streaming apps.
customer_reviews.author: cedarbase

customer_reviews.title: Plays every file format I've tried
customer_reviews.text: Kind of an uninspired screen interface.I don't think there is anything else that makes it this easy or this inexpensive to play video or music stored on a computer or NAS (network storage device.) This plays every format that I've thrown at it. There's no reason why every media player out there can't play all the formats. Kudos to WD for making it happen.
customer_reviews.author: MelGee

customer_reviews.title: The best small device to play all types of very large videos from a NAS
customer_reviews.text: If you want a small device to play very large videos from a NAS, using simple Windows folder sharing-- this is the best of the bunch. Plays basically everything. If you want to watch Netflix, don't buy this. I had a WD TV LIVE PLUS HD for years, and I'm loving this version's design and interface. I never used mine for Netflix anyway. It has a nice remote, can fast forward 32x speed, customizable home screen. No playback stuttering, works great.
customer_reviews.author: TruthMaster

customer_reviews.title: Just O.K.  Better products out there.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great media player, but I think there are better ones hitting the market with more flexibility as to what you can pull down off the internet. I also am not really pleased with the way the guide works when browsing movies or tv. It needs to have more flexibility in that you should be able to categorize your tv, vs your movies and then, have a letter index for faster browsing.
customer_reviews.author: Callery59

customer_reviews.title: I WAND 2018 MODEL!!!!
customer_reviews.text: even having Smart tvs, i use this as an hub for my disks and conecting all arounf the house, a shame they dont made a new version, tried roku, now missing WD more tan ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jung Park

customer_reviews.title: Sad given it was a $400 dollar device
customer_reviews.text: My HDI Dune Prime 3.0 died after 5 years of work. Sad given it was a $400 dollar device. This little $80 device does just about everything the Dune did. I like the menus, the speed traversing the menus, and dealing with large directories. These guys did a nice job on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan A Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: AVOID!!
customer_reviews.text: this is the worst product ever. i had such high expectations for device. it did not play anything that it said it would, the set up process took a long time. the remote control lagged, i felt like i was pushing the buttons down to get the device to respond. all i wanted was something that will act like a VLC player for my TV, instead i received a useless black box that would not play ANYTHING.... avoid.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Buggy device! Stay away
customer_reviews.text: I was excited when I bought it but after a year owning it, it hasn't responded very well: it's always freezing up, it is very laggy, and lately it doesn't recognize any of my drives, even the YouTube app stopped working mysteriously. Really thinking about just throwing it in the garbage; don't buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Lord Tyranus

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Within 10 minutes of receiving this item, I was watching movies from my home NAS, a Synology DS214 set up as a simple share drive. Simple setup and browsing. I didn't notice any real input lag from the remote control. Perfect for kid's television. If you have any specific questions, let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey R. Raschke

customer_reviews.title: Best Media Player
customer_reviews.text: This is the best streaming media player out there. You can connect two hard drives or more using a hub. It will play almost any format which is why I say it is the best. It also can do all the popular streaming apps as well.
customer_reviews.author: W. Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed..  Slowest media player ever created!
customer_reviews.text: Slowest media player that I have ever owned! I have owned a generation 2 WD media player for several years now and figured that I should upgrade. How can my generation 2 be 3 times quicker than this one? I have had to reset the clock every time I turned it off and on. If your thinking of upgrading, stay away from this media player.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: WD media player is so easy to set up and use. After struggling with My Apple TV not playing media files from my computer tonTV, trying to convert files to work with iTunes. This product plays all my media from my PC to my TV. Some slight issues with sound and video not In sync but it's easily reminded by stopping the video and playing again. So worth it
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: ... WD when it comes to its ability to play pretty much anything
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat WD when it comes to its ability to play pretty much anything. I have utilized more feature rich media players but they often fall short in their ability to play certain types of audio and/or video. That is not a problem with the WD. The only reason that I didn't give this 5 stars is because of lack of support for PLEX.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, except that the Wi-Fi is a bit fussy about the location with regard to my Wi-Fi router. Better remote control than the previous one. Originally bought as a backup for my WDTV Live player, but I prefer to use this one now! It was most definitely necessary to download the full User Guide to understand its capabilities though
customer_reviews.author: Mike Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The interface needs to be updated and streamlined. Everything lags on it from the UI to the streaming of videos and even Netflix. You can tell the processor is very lacking in this box, but I guess that's what you get for this being so inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Plays everything. Good picture quality. An upgrade form my 5 year old Boxee Box. about 5 seconds to buffer a 2 GB .mkv over gigabit LAN connection. About 8 seconds to play the same file over Wi-Fi. The GUI and movie artwork leaves a lot to be desired but I'm here for a box that plays everything from my local NAS.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Best Value For In-Home Hosted Streaming Media Support
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an affordable streamer for mainly playing in-home hosted streaming media, this is the device for you. The WD-Live TV / Media Player is NOT the most sophisticated media streamer out there, but I give it 5 stars for two reasons: 1) It fills a niche market for those seeking a streamer with strong support for in-home hosted streaming media, and 2) the price. I'll always love the Boxee Box - my personal favorite - but they've stopped making them going forward, and prices have gone up a little for the remaining devices available. Currently at $84, the WD-Live TV / Media Player supports a wide variety of protocols to access and stream in-home hosted media.
customer_reviews.author: AvidAmazonian

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. The only player that literally plays every media type including video and pictures. I don't think they sell these anymore except for the refurbished ones, but they should
customer_reviews.author: andres m.

customer_reviews.title: Plays most or all of the common video formats and is easily connected and works
customer_reviews.text: Wow, through the years I think I have owned or tried most of these connection boxes. This is the one I can live with. Plays most or all of the common video formats and is easily connected and works. (10 minutes). Would definitely recommend. One of the best features is a usable menu for navigation that makes sense. Paired this with WDEX2 cloud server.
customer_reviews.author: dm18811

customer_reviews.title: Works well for locally stored media files, but not much else.  Buy the Roku.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed to find out it doesn't support Amazon live streaming. It has a handfull of streaming media services, but the vast majority of them are missing. Buy the Roku. It costs about the same and plays your stored media files as well as the WD and includes all the streaming services.
customer_reviews.author: James Longfellow

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I've been wanting to get this for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I've been wanting to get this for sometime. Finally bit the bullet to pair it up with WD MyBook 4TB to get all my personal movies installed and connected to my TV. I would purchase this product again from Amazon as needed. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: chief

customer_reviews.title: WD Is Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent Media Player. I also have a WD MyCloud EX4 NAS and it installed seamlessly. I was streaming a movie from the NAS to my TV in about 15 minutes. It is everything that WD claims. Some say that it is outdated, but I say it is just simple for those of us who just want to stream movies on a NAS
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: It plays every file I have! As far as the UI, no problem. I use it with my two 3tb WD MyCloud drives, works great! The remote is great too. I like the small compact size too because I'm running out of room on my TV table. All of my local ext. hdds are WD too. I love WD.
customer_reviews.author: Marcel L Sides

customer_reviews.title: due to an annoying fact that the player would lose the content at ...
customer_reviews.text: Had many problems at first,due to an annoying fact that the player would lose the content at various times when playing my music. WD was unable to determine the cause, even after numerous calls to both Level 1 & Level 2 Techs. Finally found (by myself, by accident) that the problem was that when the computer went to sleep the WD Player could no longer communicate with it, thus the loss of content. Unit now works perfectly and I couldn't ask for better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Taylor

customer_reviews.title: A movie steamer's dream
customer_reviews.text: If you torrent movies you HAVE TO own this steaming box. We have a home server with tons of movies on it, the PS3 has Cenevia that will block your movies, this move is made for that. For day to day watching Netflix we use our Apple TV, but for network streaming from the PC it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Hale

customer_reviews.title: great picture on the log in screen
customer_reviews.text: this box is buggy, you really need to spend some time with this one. to get it do what you want. great picture on the log in screen. i just put the box to the side until i have some time to dedicate to get it up and running like about 2 hours. for me that is. this is not up and running 10 min out the box don't buy this box it is crap
customer_reviews.author: moonstruck

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I want it to do. I can play my entire digital collection (from my PC and my Cloud Drive). I use it mostly to watch my old movie collection and to stream video playlists. Great price for a great product. Well done WD!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bren Walker

customer_reviews.title: Cheesey
customer_reviews.text: I've had this thing for almost 2 years and I'm ready to part ways with it. Keeps freezing. Also, it doesn't read certain files they say it's supposed to read unless you're connected to the Internet.
customer_reviews.author: DaveP

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Media Player
customer_reviews.text: This media player is awesome. It's a bummer that it doesn't have Netflix, but at the moment I don't use Netflix anyway. I can plug a thumb drive or a 4TB external hard drive into it and it will read and play from both.
customer_reviews.author: L Jason Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as a reliable media player
customer_reviews.text: I had been wrestling with playing video files for quite some time. I tried different media servers and players and always had some kind of issue. Usually video freezing or out of sync audio. When I read about the WD TV and its boast that it can play just about anything, I read and watched some reviews and for roughly $95 I decided to buy it. It has worked as promised. Not one problem playing video files. Since this is why I bought it, I am giving it 5 stars. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Great for playing video files.
customer_reviews.text: Great video file player, not much experience with streaming, no amazon prime? Shocking! It played all of my video files, some fairly old, some very new. used an external hard drive and a USB flash drive, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Champion

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up an use. Gets a 4 because I've been playing a video off a usb stick and the repeat function (in video set up or in options) is not consistent. Some times I have to set it several times to take. I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Peter V

customer_reviews.title: ... is my 3rd WD media player and am very happy with this Wifi player
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd WD media player and am very happy with this Wifi player. This is the best and probably most competitively priced network media player for all of our media that we keep on our network drive.
customer_reviews.author: GARY

customer_reviews.title: This guy is beyond awesome. It pretty much leave Chromecast and Roku in ...
customer_reviews.text: This guy is beyond awesome. It pretty much leave Chromecast and Roku in the dust. A little pricier, but FAR more versatile in its ability to also play any kind of video format when you USB attach an external drive.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Decent device
customer_reviews.text: Decent piece of hardware. I wish it could do more, like mirror my laptop and phone screen, or run even a scaled down Web browser but overall it's great at what it does.
customer_reviews.author: Nnaemeka Nwosu

customer_reviews.title: JUST ANOTHER MEDIA PLAYER-BUT THIS ONE WORKS WELL
customer_reviews.text: I own several Media Players, since I had developed some of these devices as early as 2005. This one works perfectly and is the main unit in my conference room. It has not had any problems and I would strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: human

customer_reviews.title: Older Gen takes the prize
customer_reviews.text: I have the older model and decided to extend my streaming network. First Gen is better then the newer one. This style dosnt have any of the good features. NETFLIX
customer_reviews.author: Waters

customer_reviews.title: WD TV Media Player is the ticket
customer_reviews.text: I got my wife an external hard drive for storing her movies and television series. The WD TV Media Player is the link for her between the external drive and the television. My wife loves the set up. The media player works without drama; what more can I say.
customer_reviews.author: Hawkeye-SC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome media server!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome device!! Plays everyone of my file formats easily (unlike my windows media player or iTV). Remote also easily is read around a corner where the device is stored (unlike my iTV). Great media server!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Cannot beat the quality or price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my children's school to use on their video cart. It plays every file type I have tested and it connected flawlessly to the schools network for streaming. Could not be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kris P.

customer_reviews.title: Like everything Western Digital puts together
customer_reviews.text: I sure wish I had tried one of these before blowing far more money on a Popcorn Hour A300. Like everything Western Digital puts together, this is first rate design and build quality and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: DJF007

customer_reviews.title: Nice media player.  Fills the gap..
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Good menu system. I bought a second one after seeing how nice the first one reads network drives and plays all sorts of video and picture formats.
customer_reviews.author: papatech

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little piece of equipment! Like other reviewers said, it does take a bit to respond when a button is pressed, but that doesn't really bother me. It streams movies from my hard drive perfectly, with minimal space, and great picture. Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Melody v.

customer_reviews.title: I like these. They can play a wide variety of ...
customer_reviews.text: I like these. They can play a wide variety of files and they work well with my HD Homerun Prime. The wireless option seems to work well. The only negative is the menu system. It's better on the older units
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: A bit unstable if you want to keep it on ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit unstable if you want to keep it on permanently, I get every 24 hours a message saying I should restart the unit because it is running out of memory. Never had that problem with the earlier version
customer_reviews.author: Juan Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Meets our needs. We use it only for playing our local media from external hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked like a charmed
customer_reviews.text: worked like a charmed, easy to hook up, a bit slow to boot up but not an issue, connected to wireless router in 30 sec. I bought it mainly to plug in my portable HD with movies and the likes, so total satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: barry pham

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love it..So much better at buffering and content compatibility than the TV & Bluray devices. This is replacing an older model that was fried due to no fault of WD's, and I'd buy a third in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Poor support. Answered my question with wrong info that ...
customer_reviews.text: Poor support. Answered my question with wrong info that I figured out later. They kept track of their answer and every time I called, I got the same wrong answer. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Love this device
customer_reviews.text: Love this device, it allows me to watch a ton of my movies off my external hard drive, as well as stream an almost unlimited amount of shows and movies.
customer_reviews.author: Colton J.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Firmware updates ... Beware of them and of this product.
customer_reviews.text: The WD TV Media Player was working fine out of the box, but then there was a new firmware update and it freezes every 20 minutes or so while streaming from Netflix or USB stored media. The unit does not respond to the remote control, so you cannot just turn it off or stop.The solution that I am applying is disconnect from power supply and restart the whole thing. As you can imagine, it is really annoying . Either WD fixes fast its problems with firmware or just forget WD TV Media Player from streaming or playing USB stored media . This is my second WD TV Media Player with this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Joseba Deuna

customer_reviews.title: Me Like
customer_reviews.text: After reading many negative comments about this item i still bought it as i needed something that can play all my file formats. I must say i have no complaints so far. Works just fine, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Anto

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good set top box, only drawback still need a Roku for Amazon Prime as this box cannot get it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Irby

customer_reviews.title: Really like this item
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day. A few bugs, sure, but a good price and if you are somewhat computer savvy, can solve any of the small issues pretty quickly. I even bought a second one for my upstairs tv.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn D

customer_reviews.title: This unit doesn't have the base response I like. Otherwise
customer_reviews.text: I've replaced this with a Sonos Connect because I wanted a wider frequency response. This unit doesn't have the base response I like. Otherwise, it is adequate and better suited for the video programming than for audio.
customer_reviews.author: csco

customer_reviews.title: perfect! finally found the media streamer to connect to ...
customer_reviews.text: perfect! finally found the media streamer to connect to my nas correctly. easy to use interface. small platform, wired or wireless, your choice with this one!
customer_reviews.author: yosh

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. It plays everything stored on your PC in practically any video or audio format. If your PC is to far from your TV to hook up a HDMI cable, this is your answer. Actually I like it better than the HDMI. Now you can control your movies with a remote from the couch vs sitting next to your PC.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent media player it even plays some files that my lg tv will not play.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Woodward

customer_reviews.title: I wish it had come with better instructions, but it does seem to be working ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had come with better instructions, but it does seem to be working fine. I needed it specifically so I could play a powerpoint off of a flash drive onto a HDTV without having to use a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Ekins

customer_reviews.title: ... a Roku but other than that nitpick it works fine.
customer_reviews.text: The controls aren't as fast as a Roku but other than that nitpick it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: the king

customer_reviews.title: Good Device
customer_reviews.text: Good device works well, a little hard to get it connected because the included instructions are pitiful.
customer_reviews.author: Thaley

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended - software issues - but this is the one I would buy over others I've seen
customer_reviews.author: Norm

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic media player.We hope Western Digital makes many more in future.
customer_reviews.author: Missie

customer_reviews.title: WD player lacks NetFlix support.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with NetFlix. Had I not destroyed the box, I would have sent it back. I had earlier model (that had NetFlix support) but lightning destroyed. Brought this one without reading reviews thinking it was the same great product. Shame on WD.
customer_reviews.author: RoboWolf

customer_reviews.title: WD TV Media Player
customer_reviews.text: We have been using WD TV Media Player for years. This is the second model we have bought, and it is well worth the money, if you download videos.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a media player with a small backup hard ...
customer_reviews.text: It hates to reconnect to the network to get at files from my desktop. Works great as a media player with a small backup hard drive attached by USB.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: The sound port in the back of the unit does ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound port in the back of the unit does not unless I pull the adapter part of the way out. I have bought another adapter and exchanged out the unit and I still have the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: roger meadows

customer_reviews.title: Great device! Plays pretty much everything
customer_reviews.text: Great device! Plays pretty much everything. It's so nice not having to convert files.
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon Storey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, needs some fixes
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because of its ability to play all audio formats, DTS HD mainly which is hard to find in a player like this. It does the job BUT has typical WD Live problems, doesn't always recognize my 3 media drives (while my older WD Live players always recognize them), shuts down and freezes a lot during fast forward operation (unless you do it at 2X only) which is really annoying. 1 star deduction for the fast forward issues (which has always plagued WD when using home network or USB drives) 1 star deduction for the issues of not recognizing my drives all the time (usually fixed by shutting it down and re-starting)
customer_reviews.author: Chitownburbs

customer_reviews.title: plays anything. small and compact.
customer_reviews.text: would have 5 stars if netflix were to return to the unit... but this will play just about anything worth playing. 2D/3D files, .mkv, .mp4, anything. If I take it along with our projector it's an instant theater-in-a-bag... now if it could be powered off of USB it would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: scott yu

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't play mpg4 files from an external HDD! ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't play mpg4 files from an external HDD! Very slow to load contents from HDD so no advantage vs. what already a samrt TV does
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: Pure Awesome. Can handle any file I throw at it ...
customer_reviews.text: Pure Awesome. Can handle any file I throw at it including many which my LG Smart TV device could not.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Munck

customer_reviews.title: Plays anything you throw at it.
customer_reviews.text: Best player if you download movies. Plays more formats than any other player out there.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R F

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved these media players. Works just fine..
customer_reviews.author: Phillip E. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Good Media Player
customer_reviews.text: Nice media player. Review your options before buying, other options are available. But this was right for our situation.
customer_reviews.author: Bill R

customer_reviews.title: Works well as advertised
customer_reviews.text: works well with my HDhomerun Prime unit on my home network to distribute video around my house.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Tissier

customer_reviews.title: Bought my 2nd one and its amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought my 2nd one and its amazing!!!! It works with my my cloud to stream movies all over my house!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan R.

product_meta.title: WD TV Media Player (WDBYMN0000NBK-HESN)
product_meta.description:
WD TV MEDIA PLAYER – YOUR ENTERTAINMENT JUST GOT PERSONAL.
Play virtually any file type.
Play your media in virtually any file format including MKV, AVI, MOV, ISO/VOB and much more on your TV.

Enjoy your media from many sources.
Enjoy media stored on USB and network storage devices like a My Passport Ultra, My Cloud and any computer on your network.

Stream the best entertainment.
Access thousands of hit movies, TV shows, trending videos and chart-topping music for endless entertainment.



All your media, on your big screen – You've spent time building your media collection. Now, WD TV is the best way to play it on your big screen TV. Enjoy your videos, photos and favorite songs in virtually any file format. Sit back, relax and enjoy your media in brilliant 1080p.

You have it, we'll play it – WD TV supports a wide variety of the most popular files including MKV, MP4, XVID, AVI, WMV, and MOV video formats. Get the freedom to enjoy all your media on your TV.

Enjoy media from any source – Play videos, music, and photos stored on USB and network storage devices, such as a My Passport Ultra, My Cloud, and any computer on your network. Your media library collects the content from all the sources, so finding the perfect video, song or photo to view is easier than ever.

Get the best online entertainment on your TV – Stream hit movies, view the latest viral videos, catch up on shows, stay connected to your social network, and watch highlights from the biggest games of the season. With WD TV, you can enjoy the best services on your TV.

Turn your smartphone into a remote – Use your smartphone or tablet to easily control your WD TV with the tap of a finger. Get one-touch access to your favorite online services and use the gesture pad for easy navigation to your media. It is especially great for text input when logging into a service or searching for a movie title.

Share it all on your TV with Miracast – Pair a Miracast-enabled mobile device with your WD TV and you can share exactly what's on your small screen on your big screen TV. Browse the web, watch movies in 1080p, show off vacation photos, play games and more.

A home screen made just for you – Customize your WD TV and take control of your entertainment. Add shortcuts to your personal folders for quick access to your media collection. Plus, prioritize all your favorite online services on your home screen.

Your shows on any TV at home, or away – Watch your favorite live and recorded shows on any TV in your home, just add a Slingbox. Connect WD TV to any TV in your house to access your Slingbox using the SlingPlayer app. Heading out of town? Take WD TV with you to access your Slingbox and cable service from wherever you are. With Slingbox and WD TV, you can extend your complete living room HDTV experience to another TV in your home, or around the world.

And, you're off – So easy to set up, you'll be up and running in minutes. WD TV connects to your high-speed Internet connection wirelessly, no PC required. Or use the Ethernet port to connect to your wired home network.

Stay connected to your social network – Update your status and post photos on Facebook. Access it all on your big screen TV.

Automatic play – Select your favorite Internet service, song, movie or photo slideshow to automatically play when the device is turned on. Perfect for quick access to your favorite entertainment.

Bring the arcade to your HDTV – Swap gems with Rockswap, try your luck with Texas Hold'Em or test your math skills with Sudoku. WD TV brings casual games to your big screen TV.

Stay updated with RSS feeds – Stay posted on your favorite bloggers and websites and stream the latest audio and video with timely RSS feeds. You can also add specific feeds to your dashboard to be shown as tickers so you never miss a thing.

Programmable remote – Customize buttons for quick and easy access to your favorite music, photos, videos or menu choices. Use the included programmable remote control to make your entertainment choices using our crisp, animated navigation menus.

Use your keyboard for easy searching and updating – Use the on-screen keyboard or attach your wired or wireless USB keyboard for easy text input. Perfect for searching videos on YouTube or updating your status on Facebook.

HDMI and composite video output – The HDMI port lets you connect to the highest quality HDTV or home theater. Additional composite (RCA outputs) ensure compatibility with virtually all television sets. 

Ideal for

 * Playing media file formats such as MKV, MP4, XVID, AVI, WMV, MOV and more
 * Enjoying media stored on USB and network storage devices, such as a My Passport Ultra or My Cloud and any computer on your network
 * Streaming hit movies, trending videos, TV shows, and popular online entertainment such as YouTube, Pandora, Vudu and more
 * Sharing your Miracast-enabled mobile screen on your TV
 * Effortlessly controlling your media using your smartphone or tablet with the WD TV app
 * Connecting a Slingbox to stream live TV to any room in your house


What's in the box
Media player, Remote control with batteries, Composite AV cable, AC adapter, Quick Install Guide.


System Requirements
Standard or high-definition television with HDMI, or composite video connection. Wireless network needed to enable wireless capability. 

Features at a glance

 * Play all your media files including MKV, MP4, XVID, AVI, WMV, MOV and more
 * Enjoy media stored on USB and network storage devices and any computer on your network
 * Stream hit TV shows, music and more
 * Share your Miracast-enabled mobile screen on your big screen TV
 * Customizable user interface
feature_bullets: Play all your media files including MKV, MP4, XVID, AVI, WMV, MOV and more
Enjoy media stored on USB and network storage devices like a My Passport Ultra, My Cloud and any computer on your network
Stream hit TV shows, music and more with customizable user interface
Share your Miracast-enabled mobile screen on your big screen TV
